description.value: Send a software trigger to the digitizer, provided that the option SwTrg is enabled in the parameter WaveTriggerSource and/or EventTriggerSource
Factor to convert ADC counts to volts

ADC Veto width in nanoseconds. It allows to set a protection time after the ADC saturation. In case the ADC saturation generates an inhibit, the event is not saved; in case the ADC saturation does not generate an inhibit, the triggers generated during the veto width are flagged.
AntiCoincidence Mask
Defines the trigger source (or the coincidence source) for the Time-Energy Events
This parameter defines the source of the Channel Veto
DeadTime measured by the FPGA, incremented with step of 524288 ns. Updated when reading ChRealtimeMonitor
Enable channel for the acquisition. When the channel is disabled, it doesn't give any data and its self-trigger is off.
Number of samples coming before the position of the trigger in the waveform (i.e. size of the pre-trigger window).
Length of waveform coming before the position of the trigger in the waveform.
RealTime measured by the FPGA, incremented with step of 524288 ns. Reading this parameter updates the values of ChDeadtimeMonitor, ChTriggerCnt, ChSavedEventCnt and ChWaveCnt
Number of samples in the waveform (i.e. size of the acquisition window)
Duration of the waveform
Counter of channel saved events, measured by FPGA. Updated when reading ChRealtimeMonitor
Get a 32 bit word representing the status of the channel
Counter of channel triggers, measured by FPGA. Updated when reading ChRealtimeMonitor
Counter of channel events with waveform, measured by FPGA. Updated when reading ChRealtimeMonitor
Coincidence Window Length
Coincidence Window Length
Coincidence Mask
A constant DC offset (controlled by a 16 bit DAC) is added to the analog input in order to adjust the position of the signal baseline.
Number of bits of the energy

Number of samples used to average the baseline of the Energy Filter: Fixed = depends on another parameter; Very Low = 16 samples; Low = 64 samples; MediumLow = 256; Medium = 1k; MediumHigh = 4k; High = 16K
Energy Filter Baseline Evaluation Guard after a peak in samples
Energy Filter Baseline Evaluation Guard after a peak in time
Digital Fine Gain of the Energy Filter
Energy Filter Flat Top Time in samples
Energy Filter Flat Top Time in seconds
Low Frequency Limitation for the Energy Filter
Number of samples used to average the flat top: One shot = 1 sample; LowAVG = 4 samples, Medium AVG = 16 samples, HighAVG = 64 samples.
Peaking Position (%) on the Flat top of the Energy filter
Pile Up Guard Time in samples
Pile Up Guard Time in seconds
Decay Time of the Exponential Input Signal in samples
Decay Time of the Exponential Input Signal in time
Energy Filter Rise Time in samples
Energy Filter Rise Time in seconds
High Energy value for energy skim
Low Energy value for energy skim
Event to save selector criteria
Defines the trigger source for the Time-Energy Events
Dimensionless value to convert ADC counts to volts
Determine if the channel partecipate to ITLA or ITLB.
Polarity of the input signals
Number of triggers in the previous second. Reset every second.
Width of the self-trigger. 0 means linear mode (same of 8 on DPP-PHA)
Offset of the input signal.
Re-trigger guard in samples
Re-trigger guard in time
Time Filter Rise Time is samples
Time Filter Rise Time is ns
Threshold value in counts. The value is relative to the Time filter signal

Waveform Analog Probe n.1
